      • LOOKUP_ITEM_ACCEPTED

        public static final int LOOKUP_ITEM_ACCEPTED
        A flag used in findTargetElement(Editor, int, int) indicating that if a lookup (e.g. completion) is shown in the editor, the PSI element corresponding to the selected lookup item should be returned.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • findTargetElement

        public static PsiElement findTargetElement(Editor editor,
                                           int flags)
        Note: this method can perform slow PSI activity (e.g. PsiReference.resolve(), so please avoid calling it from Swing thread.
        Parameters:
        editor - editor
        flags - a combination of REFERENCED_ELEMENT_ACCEPTED, ELEMENT_NAME_ACCEPTED, LOOKUP_ITEM_ACCEPTED
        Returns:
        a PSI element declared or referenced at the editor caret position, or selected in the Lookup if shown in the editor, depending on the flags passed.
        See Also:
        findTargetElement(Editor, int, int)

      • findTargetElement

        public PsiElement findTargetElement(Editor editor,
                                    int flags,
                                    int offset)
        Note: this method can perform slow PSI activity (e.g. PsiReference.resolve(), so please avoid calling it from Swing thread.
        Parameters:
        editor - editor
        flags - a combination of REFERENCED_ELEMENT_ACCEPTED, ELEMENT_NAME_ACCEPTED, LOOKUP_ITEM_ACCEPTED
        offset - offset in the editor's document
        Returns:
        a PSI element declared or referenced at the specified offset in the editor, or selected in the Lookup if shown in the editor, depending on the flags passed.
        See Also:
        findTargetElement(Editor, int)
